peripheral.title: NVIC
peripheral.help_text:
The nested vector interrupt controller NVIC includes the following features:
• 52 maskable interrupt channels (not including the 16 interrupt lines of Cortex®-M4 with FPU)
• 16 programmable priority levels (4 bits of interrupt priority are used)
• low-latency exception and interrupt handling
• power management control
• implementation of system control registers
The NVIC and the processor core interface are closely coupled, which enables low latency
interrupt processing and efficient processing of late arriving interrupts.
All interrupts including the core exceptions are managed by the NVIC. For more information
on exceptions and NVIC programming, refer to programming manual PM0214.

peripheral.title: NVIC
peripheral.help_text:
The nested vector interrupt controller NVIC includes the following features:
• 32 maskable interrupt channels (not including the 16 Cortex®-M0 interrupt lines)
• 4 programmable priority levels (2 bits of interrupt priority are used)
• low-latency exception and interrupt handling
• power management control
• implementation of System Control Registers
The NVIC and the processor core interface are closely coupled, which enables low latency
interrupt processing and efficient processing of late arriving interrupts.
All interrupts including the core exceptions are managed by the NVIC. For more information
on exceptions and NVIC programming, refer to programming manual PM0215.

peripheral.title: NVIC
peripheral.help_text:
The nested vector interrupt controller NVIC includes the following features:
• 68 maskable interrupt channels (not including the 16 interrupt lines of Cortex®-M3)
• 16 programmable priority levels (4 bits of interrupt priority are used)
• low-latency exception and interrupt handling
• power management control
• implementation of system control registers
The NVIC and the processor core interface are closely coupled, which enables low latency
interrupt processing and efficient processing of late arriving interrupts.
All interrupts including the core exceptions are managed by the NVIC. For more information
on exceptions and NVIC programming, refer to STM32F10xxx Cortex®-M3 programming manual.

The NVIC and the processor core interface are closely coupled, which enables low latency

The NVIC and the processor core interface are closely coupled, which enables low latency

peripheral.title: NVIC
peripheral.help_text:
The nested vector interrupt controller NVIC includes the following features:
• 82 maskable interrupt channels for STM32F405xx/07xx and STM32F415xx/17xx, and up to 91 maskable interrupt
channels for STM32F42xxx and STM32F43xxx (not including the 16 interrupt lines of Cortex®-M4 with FPU)
• 16 programmable priority levels (4 bits of interrupt priority are used)
• low-latency exception and interrupt handling
• power management control
• implementation of system control registers
The NVIC and the processor core interface are closely coupled, which enables low latency
interrupt processing and efficient processing of late arriving interrupts.
All interrupts including the core exceptions are managed by the NVIC. For more information
on exceptions and NVIC programming, refer to programming manual PM0214.

peripheral.title: NVIC
peripheral.help_text:
The nested vector interrupt controller NVIC includes the following features:
• up to 98 maskable interrupt channels for STM32F75xxx and STM32F74xxx (not including
the 16 interrupt lines of Cortex®-M7 with FPU)
• 16 programmable priority levels (4 bits of interrupt priority are used)
• low-latency exception and interrupt handling
• power management control
• implementation of system control registers
The NVIC and the processor core interface are closely coupled, which enables low latency
interrupt processing and efficient processing of late arriving interrupts.
All interrupts including the core exceptions are managed by the NVIC. For more information
on exceptions and NVIC programming, refer to programming manual PMxxxx.

peripheral.help_text:
The nested vector interrupt controller NVIC includes the following features:
• 32 maskable interrupt channels (not including the 16 Cortex®-M0 interrupt lines)
• 4 programmable priority levels (2 bits of interrupt priority are used)
• low-latency exception and interrupt handling
• power management control
• implementation of System Control Registers
The NVIC and the processor core interface are closely coupled, which enables low latency
interrupt processing and efficient processing of late arriving interrupts.
All interrupts including the core exceptions are managed by the NVIC. For more information

peripheral.title: NVIC
peripheral.help_text:
The nested vector interrupt controller NVIC includes the following features:
• 102 maskable interrupt channels (not including the 16 interrupt lines of Cortex®-M4 with FPU)
• 16 programmable priority levels (4 bits of interrupt priority are used)
• low-latency exception and interrupt handling
• power management control
• implementation of system control registers
The NVIC and the processor core interface are closely coupled, which enables low latency
interrupt processing and efficient processing of late arriving interrupts.
All interrupts including the core exceptions are managed by the NVIC. For more information

peripheral.title: NVIC
peripheral.help_text:
Both CPU1 (Cortex®-M7) and CPU2 (Cortex®-M4) cores have their own nested vector interrupt controller (respectively NVIC1 and NVIC2).
The NVIC includes the following features:
• up to 150 maskable interrupt channels for STM32H7xxx (not including the 16 interrupt lines of Cortex®-M7 / Cortex®-M4 with FPU)
• 16 programmable priority levels (4 bits of interrupt priority are used)
• low-latency exception and interrupt handling
• power management control
• implementation of system control registers
The NVIC and the processor core interface are closely coupled, which enables low latency
interrupt processing and efficient processing of late arriving interrupts.
All interrupts including the core exceptions are managed by the NVIC. For more information
on exceptions and NVIC programming, refer to PM0253 and PM0214 programming manuals for Cortex®-M7 and for Cortex®-M4, respectively.

link.index: Nested Vectored Interrupt Controllers (NVIC1 and NVIC2)

peripheral.title: NVIC
peripheral.help_text:
The nested vector interrupt controller NVIC includes the following features:
• 39 maskable interrupt channels (not including the 16 interrupt lines of Cortex®-M0)
• 16 programmable priority levels (4 bits of interrupt priority are used)
• low-latency exception and interrupt handling
• power management control
• implementation of system control registers
The NVIC and the processor core interface are closely coupled, which enables low latency
interrupt processing and efficient processing of late arriving interrupts.
All interrupts including the core exceptions are managed by the NVIC. For more information
on exceptions and NVIC programming, refer to programming manual PM0223.

peripheral.title: NVIC
peripheral.help_text:
The nested vector interrupt controller NVIC includes the following features:
• 45 maskable interrupt channels in Cat.1 and Cat.2 devices, 54 maskable interrupt channels
in Cat.3 devices and 57 channels in Cat.4, Cat.5 and Cat.6 devices. These do not include
the 16 interrupt lines of Cortex®-M3.
• 16 programmable priority levels (4 bits of interrupt priority are used)
• low-latency exception and interrupt handling
• power management control
• implementation of system control registers
The NVIC and the processor core interface are closely coupled, which enables low latency
interrupt processing and efficient processing of late arriving interrupts.
All interrupts including the core exceptions are managed by the NVIC. For more information
on exceptions and NVIC programming, refer to programming manual PM0056.

peripheral.title: NVIC
peripheral.help_text:
The nested vector interrupt controller NVIC includes the following features:
• 95 maskable interrupt channels (not including the 16 interrupt lines of Cortex®-M4 with FPU)
• 16 programmable priority levels (4 bits of interrupt priority are used)
• low-latency exception and interrupt handling
• power management control
• implementation of system control registers
The NVIC and the processor core interface are closely coupled, which enables low latency
interrupt processing and efficient processing of late arriving interrupts.
All interrupts including the core exceptions are managed by the NVIC. For more information
on exceptions and NVIC programming, refer to programming manual PM0214.

peripheral.title: NVIC
peripheral.help_text:
The nested vector interrupt controller NVIC includes the following features:
• 109 maskable interrupt channels (not including the 16 Cortex®-M33 with FPU interrupt lines)
• 16 programmable priority levels (4 bits of interrupt priority are used)
• low-latency exception and interrupt handling
• power management control
• implementation of system control registers
The NVIC and the processor core interface are closely coupled, which enables low latency
interrupt processing and efficient processing of late arriving interrupts.
The NVIC registers are banked across secure and non-secure states.
All interrupts including the core exceptions are managed by the NVIC. For more information
on exceptions and NVIC programming, refer to programming manual PM0214.

peripheral.help_text:

• 16 programmable priority levels (4 bits of interrupt priority are used)
• low-latency exception and interrupt handling
• power management control
• implementation of system control registers
The NVIC and the processor core interface are closely coupled, which enables low latency
interrupt processing and efficient processing of late arriving interrupts.
All interrupts including the core exceptions are managed by the NVIC. For more information
on exceptions and NVIC programming, refer to programming manual PM0214.

peripheral.title: NVIC
peripheral.help_text:
The nested vector interrupt controller NVIC includes the following features:
• 63 maskable interrupt channels (not including the 16 interrupt lines of Cortex®-M4 with FPU)
• 16 programmable priority levels (4 bits of interrupt priority are used)
• low-latency exception and interrupt handling
• power management control
• implementation of system control registers
The NVIC and the processor core interface are closely coupled, which enables low latency
interrupt processing and efficient processing of late arriving interrupts.
All interrupts including the core exceptions are managed by the NVIC. For more information
on exceptions and NVIC programming, refer to programming manual PM0214.

peripheral.title: NVIC
peripheral.help_text:
The nested vector interrupt controller NVIC includes the following features:
CPU1 NVIC features:
• 62 maskable interrupt channels (not including the sixteen Cortex®-M4 with DSP interrupt lines)
• 16 programmable priority levels (4 bits of interrupt priority are used)
• low-latency exception and interrupt handling
• power management control
• implementation of system control registers
CPU2 NVIC features:
• 32 maskable interrupt channels (not including the sixteen Cortex®-M0+ interrupt lines)
• Four programmable priority levels (two bits of interrupt priority used)
• low-latency exception and interrupt handling
• power management control
The NVIC and the processor core interface are closely coupled, which enables low latency
interrupt processing and efficient processing of late arriving interrupts.
All interrupts including the core exceptions are managed by the NVIC.
For more information refer to the PM0214 programming manual for Cortex®-M4, and PM056 programming manual for Cortex®-M0+.

peripheral.title: NVIC
peripheral.help_text:

• 32 maskable interrupt channels (not including the 16 Cortex®-M0 interrupt lines)
• 4 programmable priority levels (2 bits of interrupt priority are used)
• low-latency exception and interrupt handling
• power management control
• implementation of System Control Registers
The NVIC and the processor core interface are closely coupled, which enables low latency
interrupt processing and efficient processing of late arriving interrupts.
All interrupts including the core exceptions are managed by the NVIC. For more information
on exceptions and NVIC programming, refer to programming manual PM0223.
